name: Irish Beef Stew
ingredients: 225 g – Mirepoix, even portions ~75g of Onion, Celery, Carrot
instructions: Preheat oven to 450˚F
Cut potatoes into quarters and coat with 1 tbsp oil, salt, and pepper
Roast potato on a parchment-lined baking sheet on the middle rack until golden-brown, 25-28 minutes
Strip thyme leaves from stems
Roughly chop parsley
Heat Dutch oven on medium-high heat, once hot add 1 tbsp oil, then beef
Cook beef, breaking it up until no pink remains, 4-5 minutes or until temp is 74˚C/165˚F
Season with salt and pepper
Transfer beef to a large bowl and discard the beef fat
Reduce the heat to medium then add half the butter, mirepoix, thyme, and half the garlic
Cook and stir occasionally until mirepoix softens slightly, 3-4 minutes
Add Beef then sprinkle in flour
Cook, stirring often until flour coats veggies and beef, 1-2 minutes
Add broth concentrate, soy sauce and 3 cups of water to the dutch oven
Bring to boil over high heat, once boiling reduce the heat to medium low to simmer
Stir occasionally until stew thickens and veggies are tender, 10-12 minutes
While stew cooks, combine remaining garlic and 1 tbsp oil in a bowl
Half the rolls and arrange them on the baking sheet
Brush garlic oil and toast in oven on top rack until golden brown, 5-6 minutes
Stir in potatoes to the stew
Serve stew with sprinkled parsley, with garlic toast
